problem: Prove that for all integers n >= 2, (1 + n) mod 3 = 0.
reasoning: This statement can be proven using the properties of modular arithmetic and the fact that 1 + n is always even when n is odd or a multiple of 4.
program:
set-logic QF_UF

define-functor Add (n: int -> int) (
  value = if n % 2 == 0 then n / 2 else n - 1 
)

defunctor Not (value: int -> bool) (
  value = negate value
)

defunctor And (values: (int -> bool) * (int -> bool)) (
  values = map (functor Add) values
)
declare-const EQ = not (And (
  Not (
    And (Add 1 n), Add n 0)))
assert EQ
